alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 10:28AM AKDT until May 15 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...Yukon River at Eagle. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding is occuring in low lying areas around Eagle. A surge of water and ice moved past early this morning and pushed water and ice overbank. Some structures along the edge of the river were impacted by high water. Water is still over the road between town and Eagle Village. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 800 AM AKDT,a resident in Eagle reports the river is mostly ice free at this time and the water has receded since the crest this morning. Water levels will continue to fluctuate as ice runs move past the community. Water levels could increase and go overbank again if a new ice jam forms downriver from Eagle. - http://weather.gov/aprfc - If you live near or along the Yukon River at Eagle stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
